headerText: The `v-hover` component provides a clean interface for handling hover states for any component.

usage.desc: The `v-hover` component is a wrapper that should contain only one child element, and can trigger an event when hovered over. In order for `v-hover` to work properly, either the `value` prop should be set to `true` or the wrapped element should contain `slot-scope="{ wrapper }"`.

disabled.desc: The `disabled` prop disables the hover functionality.

open-and-close-delay.desc: Delay `v-hover` events by using `open-delay` and `close-delay` props in combination or seperately.

hover-list.desc: `v-hover` can be used in combination with `v-for` to make a single item stand out when the user interacts with the list.

transition.desc: Create highly customized components that respond to user interaction.
